messages.subject: Re: Searching for the best unschooling forum for me!
messages.msgSnippet: ... Almost all of the unschooling boards *I* know of are secular. The bigger boards all are. Although religion does come up occasionally the moderators
messages.messageBody:
--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, "pentaitalia" <shonnalee@...>
wrote:
>I
> have joined several of them, but as I have perused them the last few
> weeks, none of them yet feels like a great fit.
> So I am looking for advice...does anyone know of a good unschooling
> group with an athiest or agnostic or secular slant?

Almost all of the unschooling boards *I* know of are secular. The
bigger boards all are. Although religion does come up occasionally the
moderators consistently work to keep those discussions directly
related to unschooling (as Sandra did, here, just recently).

As far as finding a "good fit" - some of that is just personalities,
but there are boards with specific purposes - like U. Basics for newer
unschoolers, or Always U. for folks with younger children.

---Meredith (Mo 5.5, Ray 13)

messages.subject: Searching for the best unschooling forum for me!
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all, I have just been to Corvalis, Life is Good, and came away with a printout of many unschooling sites and yahoo groups to check out. I have joined
messages.messageBody:
Hi all,
I have just been to Corvalis, Life is Good, and came away with a
printout of many unschooling sites and yahoo groups to check out. I
have joined several of them, but as I have perused them the last few
weeks, none of them yet feels like a great fit.
So I am looking for advice...does anyone know of a good unschooling
group with an athiest or agnostic or secular slant?

Thanks!
